body.p: As your deployment grows and changes, you may need to add more compute hosts to increase your capacity for VMs, or delete a host to reallocate hardware for a different use. To accomplish these tasks, in previous versions of Helion OpenStack you had to use the command line to update configuration files and run ansible playbooks. Now Operations Console (Ops Console) provides a graphical interface for you to complete the same tasks quickly using menu items in the console.
body.note: In order to use Ops Console, you need to have the correct permissions and know the URL or VIP connected to Ops console during installation. For steps on how to complete these tasks, see Using the Operations Console.

section.title: Creating Hosts
section.p: If you need to create additional compute hosts for more virtual machine capacity, you can do this easily on the Compute Hosts screen.

ol.li:
To open Operations Console, in a browser enter either the URL or Virtual IP connected to Ops Console.
For example:https://myhelion.test:9095 https://VIP:9095
On the Home screen, click the Configure Host tab.
At the top of the screen, next to Create Host, click the down arrow.

section.p: If you need to scale down the size of your current deployment to use the hardware for other purposes, you may want to delete a compute host. Or if you have multiple compute nodes and for debugging reasons you want to disable them all except one, you may need to deactivate and then activate a compute host. This can be done easily in the Operations Console.
